visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts chartOptions object to render a chart with the following specifications: Chart type: area, Chart title: 'A gridZIndex of 4 renders the grid lines above the graph', Axes and labels styling: Use a dark gray color (#333) for axis labels and titles, with a font size of 14px, Data series: Provide the data for one series named 'Monthly Data' with values [29.9, 71.5, 106.4, 129.2, 144.0, 176.0, 135.6, 148.5, 216.4, 194.1, 95.6, 54.4], Custom colors: Use a gradient from light blue to dark blue for the area fill, Additional configurations: Set the chart background to a light gray color (#f4f4f4), add a legend with the position set to 'bottom', and set the chart margins to 50 pixels on all sides.

title.text: A gridZIndex of 4 renders the grid lines above the graph

visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts chartOptions object is configured to render an area chart with a specific title, axis labels styling, and data series. The chart type is set to 'area', and the title is styled with a dark gray color and a font size of 14px. The x-axis categories represent months, and the grid lines are rendered above the graph due to the gridZIndex set to 4. The y-axis is labeled with 'Values' and also styled with the same dark gray color and font size. The data series named 'Monthly Data' contains monthly data values, and the area fill uses a gradient from light blue to dark blue. The chart background is set to a light gray color, and the legend is positioned at the bottom of the chart. The chart margins are set to 50 pixels on all sides to provide adequate spacing around the chart.
